title: UPS Cargo Plane Crashes After Takeoff in Louisville; Airport Closed
snippets: UPS plane crashes in Kentucky, injuries reported Reuters
UPS cargo plane crashes on takeoff from Louisville, Kentucky, airport, igniting huge fire AP News
A large plume of smoke could be seen near the airport, which is closed, according to the Federal Aviation Administration.
A UPS flight with three crewmembers crashed near Louisville, but the cause and extent of injuries were unclear.

Local police reporting unknown number of injuries as plume of smoke visible south of airport just before 5.30pm A plane has crashed near Louisville international airport in Kentucky, with local police officials reporting an unknown number of injuries. A UPS flight took off from the airport and crash

summary: A UPS cargo plane crashed shortly after takeoff from Louisville, Kentucky, causing a large fire and emitting a significant plume of smoke visible near the airport, which is now closed. The crash involved three crew members aboard the flight. While the extent of injuries and the cause of the crash remain unclear, local police have reported an unspecified number of injuries. The Federal Aviation Administration has confirmed the incident.

title: Amazon Threatens Legal Action Against Perplexity Over AI Browser Use
snippets: Perplexity receives legal threat from Amazon over agentic AI shopping tool Reuters
Amazon wants Perplexity to prevent its users from using its AI browser called Comet to make purchases on their behalf.
Perplexity says Amazon is "bullying" it over the agentic AI web browser Comet and its access to Amazon's storefront.

Amazon doesn’t want to be a part of Perplexity’s AI-powered shopping experience. In a post on Tuesday, the ecommerce giant says it has “repeatedly requested” that Perplexity stop allowing its Comet AI browser to buy products for customers, which Perplexity has responded to by accusing Amazon of “bul
Amazon won't allow agents on its site that don't identify themselves as such. Perplexity is not pleased.

summary: Amazon has issued a legal threat to Perplexity, demanding the company stop its AI browser, Comet, from making purchases on Amazon's platform. Amazon argues that agents must identify themselves, a policy Comet violates. Perplexity accuses Amazon of bullying over this issue. The current status is a dispute between the two companies regarding the use of AI for shopping on Amazon's site.

title: Former VP Dick Cheney, Key Figure in Iraq War, Dies at 84
snippets: Former Vice President Dick Cheney has died at age 84. And, today, voters in New York, Virginia and New Jersey choose new leaders in key races.
Dick Cheney, powerful former US vice president who pushed for Iraq war, dies at 84 Reuters
The Washington insider whose vast experience of American politics was crucial to the presidency of George W Bush and widely seen as the architect of the "war on terror.
Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful and polarizing vice presidents in US history, dies at 84 AP News

Vice president under George W. Bush, Cheney played a pivotal role in shaping the US "war on terror." He would later become a somewhat surprising Donald Trump detractor, in support of his daughter Liz.
Former Vice President Cheney, architect of Iraq War, dies at 84 Axios
A former defense secretary and congressman, he held the nation’s No. 2 job under President George W. Bush and was an architect of policies in an era of war and economic change.
Former Vice President Dick Cheney dies, architect of the nation's longest war as he plotted the global response to the 9/11 terror attacks
Dick Cheney, the hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarizing vice-presidents in U.S. history and a leading advocate for the invasion of Iraq, has died at age 84.
Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.
From "Vice" to "Veep": Dick Cheney's death recalls how Hollywood portrayed him and other VPs, real and fictional, and how he redefined the way we view the power of the office.

Cheney, who served under presidents from Nixon to George W Bush, will be remembered for controversial role after 9/11 Dick Cheney created the ground for Trump’s excesses, despite their differences Dick Cheney , the divisive US vice-president under George W Bush who helped lead the country into a dis
titles: Former Vice President Dick Cheney dies. And, Election Day races to watch

Former Vice President Cheney, architect of Iraq War, dies at 84 - Axios
Dick Cheney, Powerful Vice President and Washington Insider, Dies at 84
Dick Cheney, former vice president who unapologetically supported wars in Iraq, Afghanistan, dies at 84
Dick Cheney, powerful and polarizing U.S. vice-president to George W. Bush, dead at 84
Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful vice presidents in American history, dies at 84
Dick Cheney and Hollywood's vice presidents
Dick Cheney, vice-president and giant of Republican politics, dies aged 84
summary: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a central figure in shaping the US "war on terror" and the invasion of Iraq, has died at age 84 due to complications from pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease. Cheney, known for his influential and polarizing role in American politics, particularly during George W. Bush's presidency, was also recognized for his extensive political career spanning from Nixon to Bush. His death marks the end of a significant chapter in U.S. political history.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi Hits Philippines: 26 Dead, Helicopter Crash Kills 6
snippets: Dozens killed, army helicopter downed as Typhoon Kalmaegi hits Philippines Reuters
A Philippine military helicopter crashed during search and rescue operations, killing all six people on board.

Typhoon Kalmaegi slammed into the Philippines with heavy rains and strong winds, setting off flash floods and forcing residents to their rooftops. Dozens died, including the crew of a military helicopter.
Most of the victims drowned, the authorities said. Hundreds of thousands of people evacuated before Typhoon Kalmaegi hit on Tuesday.

Typhoon Kalmaegi has left at least 26 people dead in the Philippines, mostly in flooding set off by the storm, which barrelled across the central part of the country on Tuesday, disaster response officials said.
Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves at least 26 dead in Philippines, with survivors trapped on roofs and in cars AP News

summary: Typhoon Kalmaegi struck the Philippines, causing widespread flooding and destruction. At least 26 people have died, mostly from drowning. During the disaster, a military helicopter crashed during a rescue operation, killing all six onboard. Hundreds of thousands evacuated ahead of the storm, which hit the country on Tuesday.

title: Pelicans' Zion Williamson Out 7-10 Days with Hamstring Strain
snippets: Zion Williamson will miss at least 7-10 days with a Grade 1 hamstring strain. Williamson leads the winless Pelicans in points, rebounds and assists.
New Orleans is 0-6 to open the season, and is -28.7 points per 100 possessions this season when Zion is off the court.
Star forward Zion Williamson was diagnosed with a grade 1 left hamstring strain and will be sidelined for 7-10 days before being re-evaluated, the team announced on Tuesday.

He will be out for 7-10 days before re-evaluation. His absence is significant for the winless Pelicans, who are 0-6 this season and perform notably worse without him, showing a -28.7 point differential per 100 possessions when he's off the court.

title: Ottawa Man Charged with Second-Degree Murder, Attempted Murder in Stabbings
snippets: Ottawa police have charged a man with second-degree murder after the victim of a recent stabbing died from their injuries. The same accused is also charged with attempted murder for a seperate stabbing incident that happened just a day later.
A 35-year-old man faces charges of second-degree murder and attempted murder for two stabbings in October.

A man is facing two serious charges after two stabbing incidents that happened within a day of each other. He is also facing an attempted murder charge for another stabbing that occurred within 400 metres and a day apart from the first incident in the ByWard Market.

title: Trump Renominates Isaacman for NASA Chief, Reverses May Decision
snippets: President Trump has renominated Jared Isaacman to run NASA after pulling his prior nomination in May.

President withdrew Jared Isaacman’s nomination in May but says on Truth Social he is ‘ideally suited’ for top role Donald Trump has renewed his nomination for the billionaire private astronaut Jared Isaacman to become Nasa administrator. “This evening, I am pleased to nominate Jared Isaacman, an acc

President Donald Trump renominated Elon Musk ally Jared Isaacman to lead NASA on Tuesday, a major about-face just five months after the White House ended his candidacy as relations between Trump and Musk soured.
titles: Trump renominates Musk ally Jared Isaacman to run NASA months after withdrawal

Trump Revives Billionaire Isaacman’s Nomination to Top NASA Job
summary: President Donald Trump has renominated billionaire private astronaut Jared Isaacman to be the NASA administrator, reversing his decision from May when Isaacman's nomination was withdrawn. Trump announced the renomination on Truth Social, stating Isaacman is "ideally suited" for the position. This move comes after a previous fallout between Trump and Elon Musk, an ally of Isaacman, had initially soured Isaacman's candidacy.

title: Sabalenka vs. Kyrgios in Dubai "Battle of the Sexes" Dec 28
snippets: World number one Aryna Sabalenka will face Nick Kyrgios in a 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition match in Dubai later this year.

Australian tennis star to meet Belarusian in December in Dubai ‘I’m not just here to play, I’m here to entertain,’ says Kyrgios Nick Kyrgios, Australian former Wimbledon finalist, is to play women’s world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka in an exhibition match in Dubai. The clash evokes memories of the 1973 Bat
Top-ranked Aryna Sabalenka will play former Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios in a “Battle of the Sexes” exhibition match in Dubai on Dec. 28.
titles: Sabalenka to face Kyrgios - but could 'Battle of Sexes' damage women's sport?
Nick Kyrgios to play women’s No 1 Aryna Sabalenka in Battle of the Sexes clash
Aryna Sabalenka to play Nick Kyrgios in ‘Battle of the Sexes’ exhibition match
summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka and Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios are set to play in a "Battle of the Sexes" exhibition match in Dubai on December 28. The event, reminiscent of the 1973 Battle of the Sexes, will showcase the current women's top-ranked player against the former Wimbledon finalist.

title: Apple iOS Update Adds Transparency Control for Liquid Glass Design
snippets: Apple's latest iOS update doesn't introduce major features, but it does bring one highly requested tweak: the ability to change the transparency of the translucent liquid glass design.
New updates include a small but noteworthy batch of fixes and features.
titles: iOS 26.1 lets you turn down liquid glass’ transparency
Apple releases iOS 26.1, macOS 26.1, other updates with Liquid Glass controls and more
summary: Apple's latest iOS update includes minor fixes and features, with a key update allowing users to adjust the transparency of the translucent liquid glass design. This change addresses a highly requested tweak by users.

title: "Studies: Melatonin Risks, Exercise Benefits, Smoking Links to Diabetes"
snippets: Long-term melatonin use for sleep problems may come with unexpected heart dangers. Researchers found that chronic users were almost twice as likely to die and 3.5 times more likely to be hospitalized for heart failure. Though melatonin is widely regarded as harmless, experts now urge caution with ex

An international team of researchers reports that the immune cells of older adults with a history of endurance training are more effective at combating inflammation. Black and Hispanic populations, as well as individuals with underlying health conditions, are also at higher risk. titles: Think melatonin is safe? New research reveals a hidden heart risk
Exercise “Trains” the Immune System, New Research Reveals
New Research Reveals Vaping May Increase Your Risk of Diabetes
summary: Recent studies highlight health risks and benefits: Long-term melatonin use is linked to increased heart dangers, including nearly double the risk of death and a 3.5-fold increase in hospitalization for heart failure, prompting calls for caution. Meanwhile, endurance training in older adults boosts immune cell effectiveness against inflammation, underscoring physical activity's broad health advantages. title: Everglades Threatened by 'Forever Chemicals'; Courts Split on Trump Policies
snippets: ‘Forever Chemicals’ Represent New Environmental Threat for Florida’s Fragile Everglades Inside Climate News
Federal Courts Divided, So Far, on Trump’s Environmental Retreat Inside Climate News
titles: ‘Forever Chemicals’ Represent New Environmental Threat for Florida’s Fragile Everglades - Inside Climate News
Federal Courts Divided, So Far, on Trump’s Environmental Retreat - Inside Climate News
summary: The Everglades in Florida are facing a new environmental threat from 'Forever Chemicals,' as reported by Inside Climate News. Meanwhile, federal courts show division on the issue of former President Trump's environmental policies, with no unified stance yet.
